title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 275/285 to the US dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 275/285 to the US dollar on Wednesday dealers said as the forex market is still struggling to establish a free float amid low policy rates interest rates and surrenders.
On Tuesday the rupee traded in the interbank market at 280 to the US dollar and later small deals were done at around 273 to 274, to the US dollar, market participants said.
Deals were also done around 265 levels shortly after opening, Wednesday, dealers said.
Sri Lanka has raised bus fares and fuel prices as part of the efforts to stop a further build up of credit and money printing through the policy rate.

Analysts and economists have called for an end to soft-pegged currency regime (flexible exchange rate) which is creating high inflation and social unrest and commit the central bank to a single anchor (floating rate with inflation target) or a peg with floating short term rates. (Colombo/Mar16/2022)
